name: scab
content:
scab noun
(SKIN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a rough surface made of dried blood that forms over a cut or broken skin while it is healing Compare
scar noun
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
damage to the bodyinjuryHe was treated for minor injuries.woundMost of the casualties had gunshot wounds.cutHe walked away from the car crash with only cuts and bruises. gashHe was bleeding profusely from a deep gash in his leg.scratchShe had little scratches all over her arms. lacerationA doctor's report said the laceration had cut the jugular vein.
See more results »
[ U ] a skin disease in animals, especially sheep: The animals were all in a poor condition and were suffering from sheep scab. Compare
scabies
[ U ] a plant disease that causes hard, dry areas on fruit or leaves, especially on apples and potatoes: Plants grown from seed are more susceptible to apple scab.
